body_html:
We should probably think of a better way to test for Bazel version. Also we should definitely include your stable release in bazel release testing of tensorflow. /cc @gunan
…
On Sat, Sep 30, 2017 at 5:19 PM Martin Wicke ***@***.***> wrote: I bet you are testing TF at head, which works. This is about the latest stable (released) version of TF. Apparently, the flag alone does not fix the issue though (see above). If you guarantee no breaking changes for patch, we can check for Bazel minor version in configure and issue a stern warning if it doesn't match exactly. It's a little sad because I'd love to get rid of configure and the less we rely on it the better. The problem is that the compatibility check and error message inside our build files is useless if Bazel dies before executing it. That happened before, so we went back to a configure based solution. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#13377 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ADjHf7CreuNwsBcz2bSB7nytgzOoutnrks5snlwJgaJpZM4PocIU> .
body_text:
We should probably think of a better way to test for Bazel version. Also we
should definitely include your stable release in bazel release testing of
tensorflow.

/cc @gunan

…
On Sat, Sep 30, 2017 at 5:19 PM Martin Wicke ***@***.***> wrote:
 I bet you are testing TF at head, which works. This is about the latest
 stable (released) version of TF. Apparently, the flag alone does not fix
 the issue though (see above).

 If you guarantee no breaking changes for patch, we can check for Bazel
 minor version in configure and issue a stern warning if it doesn't match
 exactly.

 It's a little sad because I'd love to get rid of configure and the less we
 rely on it the better. The problem is that the compatibility check and
 error message inside our build files is useless if Bazel dies before
 executing it. That happened before, so we went back to a configure based
 solution.

 —
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.

body:
We should probably think of a better way to test for Bazel version. Also we
should definitely include your stable release in bazel release testing of
tensorflow.

/cc @gunan

On Sat, Sep 30, 2017 at 5:19 PM Martin Wicke <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> I bet you are testing TF at head, which works. This is about the latest
> stable (released) version of TF. Apparently, the flag alone does not fix
> the issue though (see above).
>
> If you guarantee no breaking changes for patch, we can check for Bazel
> minor version in configure and issue a stern warning if it doesn't match
> exactly.
>
> It's a little sad because I'd love to get rid of configure and the less we
> rely on it the better. The problem is that the compatibility check and
> error message inside our build files is useless if Bazel dies before
> executing it. That happened before, so we went back to a configure based
> solution.
>
> —
